subject: Critical Thinking
title: Peter Singer and Effective Altruism: Ethics by the Numbers
description: A micro-lesson that makes Peter Singer and Effective Altruism: Ethics by the Numbers usable.

hook.text: A child is drowning in a pond. You'd ruin your $200 shoes to save them.

buildup.text: Peter Singer's argument: physical distance doesn't change moral obligation.

discovery.text: Effective altruism: use evidence & reason to determine the most effective ways to help others.

twist.text: Critics: it reduces ethics to calculation.

climax.text: Singer's challenge remains powerful: we routinely spend on luxuries while others die from preventable causes.

quiz.question: What is Peter Singer's core argument about distance and moral obligation?
options: We should only help people we can see
Physical distance doesn't reduce our moral obligation to prevent suffering
Charity should be limited to our community
